comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This is a pic of members of the Manavadar state hockey team, which toured New Zealand and Australia in May-September 1938. It was not the Indian national team as such. The tour was sponsored by the Nawab of Manavadar, who was himself a player of note. Also see Also see acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=22851 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=22852 This 1938 Manavadar team had a number of fine players, including captain, Syed Mohammed Hussain (1911-1975), vice-captain Shabban Shahab-ud-Din (1909-1993), and Peter Fernandes (1916-1981), all of whom represented India at the 1936 Olympics, and also Feroz Khan (1904-2005), who represented India at the 1928 Olympics. At the time Manavadar were one of the leading Indian teams. The Indian men's hockey team were Olympic champions from 1928-1956. Throughout this period they had some fantastic players, including 'Player of the Century' Dhayan Chand (1906-1979), who represented India at the 1928, 1932 and 1936 Olympics. One of their notable wins was in the final at the 1936 Berlin Olympics, where they beat home team Germany 8-1, with Hitler watching on. There's a good pic of the 1938 Manavadar team taken in Wellington, New Zealand at - beta.natlib.govt.nz/records/23205598 and an action shot beta.natlib.govt.nz/records/23127438 During the 1920s and 1930s, Australian and New Zealand hockey teams were not competitive at an international level, with the result that the visiting Indian teams won most of the games they played, in many instances by large margins. Note that the State Library of NSW web-site has several other pics of this 1938 Manavadar team (links above), and also several pics of the 'all-India' team which toured New Zealand and Australia in 1935...including this pic of Indian captain Dhayan Chand, taken in Sydney in August 1935 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=81891

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Since writing the above I've found Geoff Watson's excellent 2005 article on the Indian hockey tours to Australia and New Zealand in the 1920s and 1930s - www.hockeynz.co.nz/documents/ASSH%20article%202004%20amen... The names of ?some players in this photograph can be established via one of the pics in Watson's article.
